meanings.definition: A title of respect used before a man's name in Spanish-speaking countries.
meanings.sent1: In Spain, it is common to address someone as 'San' before their name.
meanings.sent2: The custom of using 'San' before a name is a sign of respect in Spanish-speaking cultures.
meanings.sent3: When Juan introduced himself as 'San Juan', everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The title 'San' before a name is like a crown of honor in Spanish-speaking countries.
meanings.sent5: The word 'San' adds a touch of formality and reverence to a person's name.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Japan, equal to 100 sen.
meanings.sent1: I need to exchange my dollars for some Japanese 'san'.
meanings.sent2: The price of the item was 50 'san' in the store.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally paid with 'san' instead of yen, causing confusion at the store.
meanings.sent4: In Japan, 'san' is like the cent in the United States, but worth more.
meanings.sent5: The 'san' coin gleamed in the sunlight, a symbol of Japanese economy.

meanings.definition: A suffix attached to the names of Japanese companies.
meanings.sent1: Many well-known corporations in Japan have the 'san' suffix in their names.
meanings.sent2: When visiting Tokyo, you will notice the prevalence of 'san' in company names.
meanings.sent3: The 'san' at the end of the company name made it sound more prestigious.
meanings.sent4: Adding 'san' to a company name is like putting a stamp of quality on it.
meanings.sent5: The 'san' suffix signifies a long-standing tradition of excellence in Japanese businesses.
